HelpXML.Title: OPTrho
HelpXML.Purpose: OPTrho computes rho function for optimal weight function

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator (beta in regression or mu in the location case ...)

Item.Name: rhoOPT
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector which contains the Tukey's biweight rho associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample Function OPTrho transforms vector u as follows | (1/3.25*c^2) x^2/2 |x|<=2c | \rho(x,c) = | (1/3.25) * (1.792 - 0.972 * (x/c)^2 + 0.432 * (x/c)^4 - 0.052 * (x/c)^6 + 0.002 * (x/c)^8) 2c<=|x|<=3c | | 1 |x|>3c Remark: Yohai and Zamar (1997) showed that the $\rho$ function given above is optimal in the following highly desirable sense: the final M estimate has a breakdown point of one-half and minimizes the maximum bias under contamination distributions (locally for small fraction of contamination), subject to achieving a desidered nominal asymptotic efficiency when the data are Gaussian.
